attributes.action: consider the provision of state-owned accomodation for MPs and their families (including schools), to replace the current "second homes" and other associated allowances; such provision to be within a 5-mile radius of Westminter.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This might go some way towards reducing the mass of allowances and expenses currently claimable by MPs, and seen by the general public as a major source of income.  Expenses should not provide personal benefit to MPs but cover justifiable costs. For example, the funding of a mortgage for a second home generates financial gain for the mortgage-holder; any profit accruing from this practice cannot be justified under an expenses or allowances heading.

Currently:-

2nd HOMES ALLOWANCE - In 2008/9 the allowance limit is £24,006.

SALARY AND ALLOWANCES - Annual salary of £63,291 and allowances received for the costs of running an office, having homes both near Westminster and in their constituency, and travelling between both. Average claimed by each MP £135,600 a year.

TRAVEL EXPENSES - There is no limit on the amount of travel expenses.

SALARY AND ALLOWANCES - MPs paid £63,291 p.a. and receive allowances for the costs of running an office, having homes both near Westminster and in their constituency, and travelling between both. Average claimed by each MP £135,600 a year.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
